alert.note: Alert for Essex; King William; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 3:55PM EDT until August 04 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL KING AND QUEEN...EAST CENTRAL KING WILLIAM AND SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX COUNTIES... At 355 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near King William, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Stevensville around 415 PM EDT. King And Queen Court House around 425 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Upright, Bruington, Walkerton, Crouch, Henley Fork and Rose Garden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Essex; King William; King and Queen
